Homework (due 0216)

Complete these for Friday, February 16. Where appropriate, show work that justifies your answers for full credit.

  1. Find the slope (if it exists) and inclination (rounded to nearest degree or tenth of a radian) of the line through the given points:

    1. \((2,3)\) and \((5,8)\)

      The slope is \(\frac{8-3}{5-2},\) or \(\frac{5}{3}.\) To get the inclination, we use inverse tangent: \(\tan^{-1}(\frac{5}{3})\approx 59^\circ.\) Thus \(59^\circ\) is our approximate inclination.

    2. \((-1,4)\) and \((4,2)\)

      The slope is \(\frac{2-4}{4--1},\) or \(-\frac{2}{5}.\) To get the inclination, we use inverse tangent: \(\tan^{-1}(-\frac{2}{5})\approx -22^\circ.\) Since the inclination must be an angle between \(0^\circ\) and \(180^\circ,\) we must add \(180^\circ\) to get an obtuse angle as our final answer: \(-22^\circ + 180^\circ = 158^\circ.\)

    3. \((-4,2)\) and \((-4,5)\)

      Since these two points have the same \(x\)-coordinates, these two points are on the same vertical line. There is no slope and the inclination is \(90^\circ.\)

    4. \((2,3)\) and \((-4,3)\)

      Since these two points have the same \(y\)-coordinates, these two points are on the same horizontal line. The slope is \(0\) and the inclination is \(0^\circ.\)

  2. Find an equation of the line indicated and sketch the graph:

    1. contains \((2,-4)\) with slope \(m=-2\)

      We can use point-slope form: \(y-(-4)=-2(x-2).\)

    2. contains \((2,2)\) with slope \(m=1\)

      We can use point-slope form: \(y-2=1(x-2).\)

    3. contains \((5,3)\) with slope \(m=4\)

      We can use point-slope form: \(y-3=4(x-5).\)

    4. contains \((3,4)\) with slope \(m=0\)

      Since the slope is zero, this is a horizontal line: \(y=4.\)

    5. contains \((-2,-3)\) and has no slope

      Since there is no slope, this is a vertical line: \(x=-2.\)

    6. contains \((1,4)\) and \((3,5)\)

      We can use two-point form: \(y-4=\frac{5-4}{3-1}(x-1).\)

    7. contains \((-3,4)\) and \((3,-4)\)

      We can use two-point form: \(y-4=\frac{-4-4}{3--3}(x--3).\)

    8. contains \((2,-1)\) and \((-2,-1)\)

      Since these two points have the same \(y\)-coordinates, these two points are on the same horizontal line: \(y=-1.\)

  3. The vertices of a triangle are \((2,3),\) \((-1,5),\) and \((-2,-3).\) Give equations for the lines that contain the sides of this triangle.

    Here are equations for each of the three sides:

    • side containing \((2,3),\) and \((-1,5)\): \(y-3=\frac{5-3}{-1-2}(x-2).\)
    • side containing \((-1,5)\) and \((-2,-3)\): \(y-5=\frac{-3-5}{-2--1}(x--1).\)
    • side containing \((2,3)\) and \((-2,-3)\): \(y-3=\frac{-3-3}{-2-2}(x-2).\)
